channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Portland Trail Blazers fans react to gambling scandal
item.description: The Portland Trail Blazers head coach was among several NBA figures arrested this week for allegedly participating in illegal gambling schemes.
item.content:encoded: The Portland Trail Blazers head coach was among several NBA figures arrested this week for allegedly participating in illegal gambling schemes.
item.dc:creator: Joni Auden Land

item.title: President Trump cancels his Putin meeting and reignites tensions with new sanctions
item.description: New sanctions on Russian oil giants show President Trump's frustration with President Putin as his peace effort falters.
item.content:encoded: New sanctions on Russian oil giants show President Trump's frustration with President Putin as his peace effort falters.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: On the frontlines of Peru's forgotten cocaine war
item.description: The Trump administration's goals to crack down on drug trafficking may be at odds with cuts to aid programs meant to fight coca at its source in the Amazon
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration's goals to crack down on drug trafficking may be at odds with cuts to aid programs meant to fight coca at its source in the Amazon
item.dc:creator: Simeon Tegel

item.title: The Port of Houston is feeling the shock of tariffs and a stalled government
item.description: The Port of Houston is feeling the strain as unpaid customs officers, rising tariffs, and a prolonged government shutdown disrupt trade and threaten jobs across Texas.
item.content:encoded: The Port of Houston is feeling the strain as unpaid customs officers, rising tariffs, and a prolonged government shutdown disrupt trade and threaten jobs across Texas.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Schneider

item.title: Prime Minister Netanyahu stands increasingly alone at home and abroad
item.description: As the ceasefire takes hold, Prime Minister Netanyahu faces a turning point in his political future, according to Anshel Pfeffer of The Economist.
item.content:encoded: As the ceasefire takes hold, Prime Minister Netanyahu faces a turning point in his political future, according to Anshel Pfeffer of The Economist.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: Inside NATO's once-secret nuclear exercise
item.description: For the first time, NATO allowed journalists to witness its annual nuclear exercise, a once-secret event that now serves as both a show of transparency and a message of deterrence toward Russia.
item.content:encoded: For the first time, NATO allowed journalists to witness its annual nuclear exercise, a once-secret event that now serves as both a show of transparency and a message of deterrence toward Russia.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: Susan Stamberg's legacy of visual storytelling
item.description: NPR's Neda Ulaby and Bob Mondello reflect on Susan Stamberg's lasting influence on arts reporting, sharing how her inventive use of sound, vivid writing, and curiosity taught generations of journalists to make listeners see what they could not watch.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Neda Ulaby and Bob Mondello reflect on Susan Stamberg's lasting influence on arts reporting, sharing how her inventive use of sound, vivid writing, and curiosity taught generations of journalists to make listeners see what they could not watch.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Leon Thomas on his new EP 'Pholks'
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with R&B musician Leon Thomas, who describes his new EP Pholks as a collaboration of polymaths inspired by multi-talented artists like Prince and Quincy Jones.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with R&B musician Leon Thomas, who describes his new EP Pholks as a collaboration of polymaths inspired by multi-talented artists like Prince and Quincy Jones.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: A youth orchestra in Ukraine creates an overture with the sounds of war
item.description: A youth orchestra in the Kyiv region composes a symphonic poem, re-creating the sound of wartime nights in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: A youth orchestra in the Kyiv region composes a symphonic poem, re-creating the sound of wartime nights in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: What today's inflation report says about the economy -- and Social Security checks
item.description: Because of the shutdown, the federal government is belatedly releasing new Consumer Price Index numbers, which the Social Security Administration needs to adjust for next year's benefits.
item.content:encoded: Because of the shutdown, the federal government is belatedly releasing new Consumer Price Index numbers, which the Social Security Administration needs to adjust for next year's benefits.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan
